If you are looking for an affordable University with a top-ranking rating in the US, search no further. Columbia University is a “Yes” University. The application for admission into Columbia University is currently open for both US Citizens and International applicants. The application fee is $85, and it also accepts application fee waivers, No loans for parents, Free tuition fees for students, $2,000 startup grants, and lots more.

Columbia University | Application Requirement

Applying for admission into Columbia University as US. For citizens and International Students, the following requirements are considered.

Apply for the Coalition Application or the Common Application. We will also accept the QuestBridge Application from QuestBridge Finalists. The applications contain the following;

  1. Autobiographical information
  2. Lists and descriptions of a student’s achievements, activities, employment and summer activities
  3. Personal essay

International Student’s Additional Requirement

  • Submit a Secondary School profile describing the school, grading system, and curricular and extracurricular resources.

Note: Columbia accepts all secondary school curricula (e.g., International Baccalaureate, Cambridge A Levels, National School curricula.

  • Submit other relevant original documents (Please, all documents, including transcripts not written in English, should be translated before submission)
  • SAT Score of 700 or higher on the Evidence-Based Reading and Writing section
  • ACT Score of 29 or higher in the English or Reading sections
  • A TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) score of 105 is required
  • IELTS (International English Language Testing System) score of 7.5
  • DET (Duolingo English Test) score of 135

Columbia University | Cost of Attendance

  • Tuition and fees: $65,524
  • New student fees: $615
  • Room and board: $16,156
  • Books and personal: $3,672
  • Total cost of attendance: $85,967

Is Columbia University Tuition-Free?

Yes. Columbia University awards tuition-free academics to students from families with annual incomes of less than $150,000 (and typical assets).

Columbia University Grant

  • $2,000 is awarded to students as a Start-up grant for incoming first-year students from low-income families
  • $0 Parent contribution for students coming from families with incomes of less than $66,000 annually (and typical assets)
  • No loans. Loans are not used to meet financial needs or are included in initial financial aid awards. Free tuition. $204 million in aid. No loans.

Application Fees and Fee Waivers

A non-refundable application fee of $85

Fee Waivers

Application fees can be waived if your annual household income is below $60,000 USD. You must request a fee waiver option during your application.

Columbia University Bookstore & Library

Columbia University, New York, continues to cater to and provide for the well-being of students. At Columbia University, students can go to markets and stores, shop for products, access a library of books, and more. Course materials are provided in the standard edition of the university course curriculum.
